name: YHA Sydney Harbour
description:
Experience Sydney like never before at our stylish and affordable hostel, perfectly located in the historic Rocks precinct with stunning views of Sydney Harbour.

Built above an archaeological dig site, this YHA is more than just a place to stay. Our hostel offers a vibrant social atmosphere where travelers connect, share stories, and create memories. 

Tired of impersonal service? We’ve got you covered with a warm, welcoming vibe and daily activities designed to bring people together. Whether you’re lounging in the spacious communal areas, joining social events, or grabbing a drink at our stunning rooftop bar, you’ll feel right at home. 
With at least two daily activities, there’s always something to enjoy! Start your day with yoga, pilates, or a group run, then dive into evenings with BBQs, Taco Night, and more. With both free and paid options, we’ve got something for everyone. 

Enjoy modern amenities, including a fully-equipped guest kitchen, on-site convenience store, and a 24-hour café offering coffee, snacks, and an à la carte menu for full service lunch and dinner. All rooms are air-conditioned with private bathrooms, free high-speed Wi-Fi throughout to keep you connected.

Make the most of your Sydney adventure with the help of our friendly team and daily activities that promise to spark new friendships, memories and unforgettable experiences.

Check-in: 2 PM – midnight | Check-out: 10 AM
Valid ID (passport, Australian driver’s license, or proof of age card) required at check-in.

Book today, unwind tomorrow, your unforgettable Sydney adventure awaits.
hostelworldSays: Sydney Harbour YHA was named the best in Australia and Oceania at the 2010 Hoscars and it?s not hard to see why ? this clean, modern hostel has a stunning view over Sydney Harbour and Sydney Opera House. Hostelworld reviewers say they highly recommend this hostel to other travellers, citing the ?large, clean ensuite rooms? and ?clean safe, family atmosphere?. We like ?the Big Dig??archaeological digs in the ground floor which can be viewed from the walkways on all levels of the hostel.

houseRules.notes:
All cancellations must be 24 hours in advance. 

Check-in from 2pm. Check-out by 10am.

A valid passport, Australian Drivers Licence or Australian Proof of Age card is required when you check in.

We require taking a profile photo of all guests staying in shared rooms. If you do not wish to have your photo taken, we will not be able to accommodate you.

Guests under the age of 18 can only check in with a parent or legal guardian.

The supervision of guests under 18 years of age remains the responsibility of their parent or legal guardian whilst at a YHA property. Guests under 18 years of age are not permitted to stay in Co-living shared dormitory rooms, they can only be accommodated in private rooms. For further information on the YHA child safety policy please contact the property directly.

Access to the rooftop on New Year’s Eve are for ticket holders only. This is an adult only event, persons under 18 will not be permitted on the rooftop. Tickets to the New Year’s Eve rooftop event must be purchased with reception. Tickets are limited and subject to availability.

categories.category_description: This hostel has confirmed that they have implemented a sustainability strategy that will lead them to certification. They’ve committed to prioritising environmental, cultural and community best practices. They may also meet a Global Sustainable Tourism Council recognised standard.
